newsitem.title: KUWAIT: Kuwait says Israel offended Moslems.
newsitem.headline: Kuwait says Israel offended Moslems.

text.p: Kuwait on Sunday blamed Israel for deadly clashes with Palestinians, saying the Jewish state was offending Moslems and violating international law.
"The cabinet condemns these Israeli practices for they represent an offence to the feelings of Moslems and a violation of international norms and law," a government statement said.
"The cabinet has monitored with grave concern the bloody events in the Palestinian territories and Holy Jerusalem and the Israeli measures which threaten the Middle East peace process," it added.

Fifty-five Palestinians were killed during five days of fighting which erupted after Israel opened an archaeological tunnel in Old Jerusalem's Moslem Quarter near al-Aqsa Mosque, Islam's third holiest shrine. Palestinian forces killed 14 Israelis in the clashes in which hundreds were wounded.
Kuwait's lawyers society said on Sunday it would join a strike by fellow Arab lawyers against "the barbarian crimes by Zionist occupation gangs."
